p: The studies on the antimicrobial activity of the essential oil and its oxygenated sesquiterpene fractions from the aerial part of E. maritimum estimated by the agar diffusion method against several bacteria revealed the significant effect of 4βH-cadin-9-en-15-al, germacrene D, 4βH-cadin-9-en-15-ol (8.3%), and 4βH-muurol-9-en-15-al mixture against Escherichia coli, Enterococcus faecalis, and Listeria monocytogenes [ 15]. Moreover, the essential oil from the aerial part of this species growing in Portugal showed the moderate activity against Leishmania infantum promastigotes growth and no activity against Giardia lamblia [ 13, 14].
